title: ElevenLabs CEO: Voice is the next interface for AI
summary: ElevenLabs CEO argued at Web Summit Qatar that voice is the next interface for AI, as OpenAI, Google, and Apple push conversational systems into wearables, new hardware, and everyday interactions.

title: Google’s subscriptions rise in Q4 as YouTube pulls $60B in yearly revenue
summary: The company said it now has 325 million paying users across Google One and YouTube Premium, up from 300 million users three months earlier.

title: Spotify ventures into physical book sales, adds new audiobook features
summary: Spotify users in the U.S. and the UK will soon be able to buy physical books in the app. There's also a new tool that syncs physical books to audiobooks.

title: Sam Altman got exceptionally testy over Claude Super Bowl ads
summary: He posted a novella-sized rant that devolved into to calling his rival "dishonest" and "authoritarian."

title: As it preps Specs for the masses, Snap’s Q4 shows revenue growth but fewer daily users
summary: The company is engaged in a strategy to diversify its revenue sources as it heads into the new year.

title: Mundi Ventures closes on €750M for Kembara, its largest deep tech and climate fund
summary: Spain-based deeptech and climate megafund Kembara has just completed a €750 million first close toward its €1 billion target.

title: Stripe alumni raise €30M Series A for Duna, backed by Stripe and Adyen execs
summary: Having raised a €30 million Series A round led by CapitalG, business identity verification startup Duna is now among the most well-capitalized European startups founded by Stripe alumni.

title: Alphabet won’t talk about the Google-Apple AI deal, even to investors
summary: Alphabet CEO skipped an analyst's question about Apple on the company's earnings call.

title: Google’s Gemini app has surpassed 750M monthly active users
summary: Google revealed a significant milestone for its Gemini app, announcing over 750 million monthly active users as it competes with ChatGPT and Meta AI.

title: The Wayback Machine debuts a new plug-in designed to fix the internet’s broken links problem
summary: Should a linked web page go offline, the new feature will then redirect readers to the archived versions, so that there is no drop in service. The tool also archives a user's own posts, helping to ensure their longevity.

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX company town is getting a police department
summary: The new department will have up to eight police officers and could be up and running in a few months.

summary: Amazon MGM Studios will reportedly begin a closed beta program in March to test its AI tools to help with film and TV production.

title: A16z just raised $1.7B for AI infrastructure. Here’s where it’s going.

title: Show HN: Micropolis/SimCity Clone in Emacs Lisp
summary:
This is a little game implemented over a week of tinkering and targeting Emacs.

The point is both to have fun with this kind of simulations, and also explore the "functional core / imperative shell" approach to architecture. I also developed a tile and tile effect definition DSL, which makes this even easier to extend. From this point of view it's a success: easy testing, easy extension,

Gameplay-wise the simulation is too simplistic, and needs input from people interested in this kind of toys. The original Micropolis/SimSity is the last time I built a virtual city.
